Class SQLStatement

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.core.automation.SQLStatement
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Loggable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ValidationStatement

    public class SQLStatement
extends Object
implements Loggable
    Represents an SQL statement.
    Author:
    Russ Tennant (russ@i2rd.com)

      • setParameter

        public void setParameter(int index,
                Object value,
                int sqlType)
        Set a parameter. If the value is NULL, then the PreparedStatement is updated with PreparedStatement.setNull(int, int).
        Parameters:
        index - the index. The first parameters is 1, the second is 2, ...
        value - the input parameter value.
        sqlType - the sql type defined in Types.
        See Also:
        PreparedStatement.setObject(int, Object, int), PreparedStatement.setNull(int, int)

      • setSource

        public void setSource(LoggableSource source)
        Set the Source. Default is execution. This is typically handled by an automation driver program.
        Parameters:
        source - the source.
